courseImplementationDetail.textbook: Essential Cell Biology, 5th or 4th Edition, Ed. by Alberts, Bray, Hopkin, Johnson, Lewis, Raff, Roberts, and Walter (Garland Science)(available as paperback or kindle e-book)https://www.amazon.co.jp/Essential-Cell-Biology-Bruce-Alberts/dp/0815344554/ref=sr_1_2?s=english-books&ie=UTF8&qid=1537496074&sr=1-2&keywords=Essential+Cell+BiologyNote: Chapters 4-7 will be daelt with in Introductory Biology II. Remaining later chapters (from Chap. 8 to Chap. 20) will be covered consecutively by Fundamental Cell Biology (Kikan Education subject) and Applied Cell Biology (Specialized subject in School of Agriculture).
courseImplementationDetail.references: Handouts may be provided in the classes, if necessary.

header.activity: 授業の内容（90分授業＝2時間）

data: Cell: The fundamental units of life

Unity and diversity of cells
Prokaryotic cell
Eukaryotic cell
Model organisms

Small molecules in cells
Macromolecules in cells

The shape and structure of proteins
How proteins works.

How proteins are controlled.
How proteins are studied.

The use of energy by cells
Free energy and catalysis

courseGradingDetail.exams: Final exam will be performed in the last lecture day.
courseGradingDetail.quizzes: Small quiz may be given in some lecture.
courseGradingDetail.report: You may asked to submit small reports on particular subjects.
courseGradingDetail.classContribution: Active attitude including questions to my explanations is encouraged.

courseObjectiveDetail.obj_en: Students learn the basics of living organisms, including cells, genes, and proteins.Introductory Biology I will deal with an overview of cell and chemical fundamentals of biomolecules by following the first three chapters of Essential Cell Biology textbook.
courseObjectiveDetail.prerequisites: This lecture is opened primarily for IUPE students, but other undergraduate course students are also welcomed as long as they can follow the contents in English.Basics of chemistry at the high school level.

degreeObjective.main: Understanding structure of cells, chemical components of the cell, including DNA, RNA and proteins, as well as their functions.

main.name: Basic Laboratory Experiments in Natural Science Ⅰ

courseObjectiveDetail.obj_jp: 人間は、自然の事物・現象の中に様々な法則を見いだしてきた。その営為である自然科学の進展には実証という過程が必然的に要求されてきた。基幹教育における自然科学総合実験の目的は、理系学生全員に人間が自然の事物・現象を基礎的な実験・観察を通してどのように理解しようとしてきたのかについて総合的に理解してもらうことにある。その過程で、受講生が様々な実験・観察の手法の基礎を学び，物事を合理的に探究する能力と態度を育てるとともに自然の事物・現象についての理解を深め，科学的な自然観を身につけることも目的の一つである。
courseObjectiveDetail.obj_en: We have found various laws in nature. For the advance of natural science, experimental studies are indispensable. The aim of the synthetic laboratory experiments course in natural science for the all students in the science, engineering, medical science, agriculture majors is to understand how we had studied the natural phenomena and physical process by the methods of observation and experiment. Students learn about the basics of the observations and experiments in natural science and acquire attitude and ability to investigate a matter rationally. They are also desired to understand natural phenomena deeper and get scientific nature-views.

degreeObjective.main: C-1-3.実験結果を分析し、論理立てて自分の考えを表現できる。Be able to analyze the result of the experiments and express your thoughts logically
degreeObjective.sub: ・Attitude to prepare for the experiments in advance.・Willingness to conduct the experiments properly according to the instructions.・Ability to properly summarize and report the experimental results.

courseObjectiveDetail.obj_jp: Overall Objective (General): The primary objective of studying Fundamental Physics I is to develop the capacity to predict the effects of force and motion, while carrying out the creative design functions of engineering. Therefore, the objectives of this course will be: (1) develop students' understanding and description of the motion of bodies.(2) develop students' ability to visualize physical configurations in terms of real materials, actual constrains and the practical limitations. (3) learning the principles and their limitations within the context of applications, and (4) providing experience in reasoning from fundamentals.Study Objectives (Specific):1. To study particle motion along a straight line 2. To investigate particle motion along a curved path using different coordinate systems 3. To analyze the accelerated motion of a particle using the equation of motion with different coordinate system
courseObjectiveDetail.obj_en: Course Overview: Mechanics (Fundamental Physics) is both a foundation and framework for most of the branches of engineering and agricultural science. It is a branch of physical sciences that is concerned with the state of rest or motion of bodies subjected to the action of forces.
courseObjectiveDetail.prerequisites: Basic knowledge in Elementary Calculus, Ordinary Differential Equations and High School Physics

degreeObjective.main: 従
